child_geo_events.address: 700 Sulphur Creek Rd, Meeker, CO 81641, USA
child_geo_events.name: Livestock Shelter - Rio Blanco County Fairgrounds

data.information:
Livestock can be taken to the Rio Blanco County Fairgrounds located at 700 Sulphur Creek Rd, Meeker, CO 81641.

The Rio Blanco County Fairgrounds is providing emergency shelter for evacuated livestock during the Elk and Lee Fires.

FACILITIES AVAILABLE:

• Outdoor pens and stalls for horses

• Small indoor pens for goats, sheep, and pigs

• Poultry cages

WHAT TO BRING:

• Hay or feed for poultry

• Water buckets

IMPORTANT: Due to the fairgrounds serving as the Incident Command Post, you will need to leave your animals in the care of the facility manager and CSU Extension staff. Nick and Dessa will handle all feeding, watering, and care.

CONTACT:

Nick Smith, RBC Fairgrounds Manager

• 970-878-9498

• 970-755-1628

Per Rio Blanco County.

An evacuation center is established at the Fairfield Center located at 200 Main Street, Meeker.

Per Rio Blanco County.

data.reporter_only_notes:
Despite 100% containment, Routt County said "All zones remain in monitor status and will stay that way until the incident is fully resolved". AJ 08/26/25

Evac zone changes need to use both sets of terminology below, as the zones are across 3 counties now. --JW/LW

GO (Evacuate)
SET (Pre-Evacuate)
READY (Monitor)

data.reporter_only_notes:
Windy Rock and Devil Mountain are being ran together per the DNRC but are still getting individual size updates through NIFC. Only use the size that comes in the morning updates, disregard NIFC for now. - 8/29, EJ

8/31 - DNRC is inconsistent. They seem to be combining the acreage in the daily updates, but NOT the perimeters anymore. We have reactivated Devil Mountain and are posting the perimeters + acreage updates to each one individually. Keep an eye out for what looks to be a large increase in size in the daily, that's them combining sizes for Windy Rock+Devil Mountain, but not actually mentioning Devil Mountain in their text. -JW

-Still merging acreage for the fires as of 9/1am report. GH

For clarity, Eagle County zone GYF-265 (smaller portion) has been "turned off" on the Eagle County Emergency Map and Genasys map so that the two zones are no longer overlapping. AJJ 08/24

There are duplicate zones named "GYF-265" which overlap and have conflicting statuses. The external status for the larger zone is incorrect. data.evacuation_advisories: Everything south of the forest boundary (end of State Highway 352) to Black Butte Road.
data.reporter_only_notes:
The fire burned very aggressively today toward the east into the wilderness. Jaimee and I discussed adding Fremont County but decided it's still a little far from the county line for that. I suggest using the Shoshone NF boundary as a trigger point to the E and Seven Lakes ATV trail to the N for adding Fremont county. Lots of wilderness out there, lots of room to run.

NIFC has 10,000 right now, not using since we have a perimeter at 13,000 8/26 -EJ

data.reporter_only_notes:
I've corrected the acreage to what is currently listed via NIFC - 10,000. I estimate through satellites that this was ~7,000 acres. Any perimeter that looks broken & non-continuous should be rejected, it burned all the way to the Walla Walla County line.

I drew a rough sketch of what the perimeter should look like - link

- MS 8/31

Based on this, I'm going ahead and posting the latest NIFC update which is indeed around 7,000 acres. JCW 8/31

data.evacuation_notes: Tuolumne County Evacuation Map

data.information:
An Evacuation Center is open at the Sonora Senior Center located at 540 Greenley Rd, Sonora. Per Tuolumne County Sheriff on Facebook.

Pets are allowed and animal control is on scene assisting.

data.information: A Large Animal Evacuation Center is open at the Mother Lode Fairgrounds located at 220 Southgate Dr, Sonora, CA. Per Tuolumne County Sheriff on Facebook.
